au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig

Interface ITestAction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAction, java.lang.Runnable

    public interface ITestAction
extends IAction, java.lang.Runnable
    Interface for an exerciser test. Each test runs in its own thread which is started on test construction. The run method should be defensive to not allow this thread to terminate. Causing this thread to terminate will cause the test to terminate and not be re-startable.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getReason()
      Gets the reason a test has failed.
      boolean getStatus()
      Gets the rig status.
      void setInterval(int interval)
      Sets the test interval which specifies how often the test executes in minutes.
      void startTest()
      Starts the test.
      void stopTest()
      Stops the test.

      • Methods inherited from interface au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.IAction

        getActionType, getFailureReason

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run

    • Method Detail

      • startTest

        void startTest()
        Starts the test. Should notify the test thread to resume testing.

      • stopTest

        void stopTest()
        Stops the test. Should notify the test thread to release any held resources, then pause until the startTest method is called to resume testing. Should NOT cause the test thread to terminate.

      • getStatus

        boolean getStatus()
        Gets the rig status. true is returned if the tested rig attribute is integral, false is returned if the test fails.
        Returns:
        true if test integral, false otherwise

      • getReason

        java.lang.String getReason()
        Gets the reason a test has failed. null is returned if the test has not failed.
        Returns:
        reason for failure

      • setInterval

        void setInterval(int interval)
        Sets the test interval which specifies how often the test executes in minutes.
        Parameters:
        interval - test interval in minutes
